Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial of Genetically Modified Mesenchymal Stromal Cells Overexpressing VEGF for Critical Limb Ischemia

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation was achieved through a computer-generated sequence

Intervention.evidence: compared MSCs overexpressing VEGF (MSC/VEGF) with unmodified MSCs

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the safety and efficacy of MSCs genetically modified to overexpress Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor (VEGF-A165).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was angiogenesis, evaluated using a Matrigel plug model over 6 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved through a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group assignments.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Forty mice were randomised, with 20 receiving MSC/VEGF and 20 receiving unmodified MSCs.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Per-protocol analysis revealed that MSC/VEGF significantly enhanced angiogenesis compared to controls

Result_Outcome.evidence: MSC/VEGF significantly enhanced angiogenesis compared to controls, with increased vascular structures (p < 0.05).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events included mild to large intramuscular hematomas at the injection site in 15% of mice

Funding.evidence: Funding: The study was supported by internal institutional grants.
